item.title: REST Constraint #1: The Power of a Uniform Interface - Chris Woody Woodruff
item.description: A well-designed REST API isn’t just a random collection of endpoints—it follows a set of principles that make it predictable, scalable, and easy to use. One of the core constraints of REST is the Uniform Interface. This principle ensures that APIs are structured consistently, reducing complexity for both developers and systems interacting with them.

item.title: MVVM is hard! How do I make it easier?
item.description:
Heard about MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel) but not sure how to integrate it into your applications? It can feel like adding too much architecture, but it doesn’t have to be challenging. James Montemagno shares how to make it easier. #OneDevQuestion
Learn more: https://msft.it/6059qXhIU

item.title: Model Context Protocol: Expanding LLM Capabilities
item.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) is a versatile and extensible protocol designed to give Large Language Models (LLMs) secure, controlled access to tools and data sources. Let's dive in!
